00295    private:
00296 
00297       /*
00298       * Struct containing an Atom* pointer and cell id for that atom.
00299       *
00300       * The CellList::placeAtom(&Atom) method calculates the cell rank
00301       * for an atom, and stores the rank and a pointer in an AtomTag.
00302       * It also increments the number of atoms in the relevant cell.
00303       * The number of atoms in each cell is known only after a loop
00304       * over all atoms. The CellList::build() method then sorts the
00305       * Atom* pointers into contiguous blocks of the handles_ array.
00306       */
00307       struct AtomTag 
00308       {
00309          Atom* handle;
00310          int cellRank;
00311       };
00312 
00314       Cell::OffsetArray offsets_;
00315 
00317       Grid   grid_;
00318 
00320       DArray<AtomTag> tags_;
00321 
00323       DArray<Atom*>   handles_;
00324 
00326       DArray<Cell>  cells_;
00327 
00329       Vector  lower_; 
00330 
00332       Vector  upper_; 
00333 
00335       Vector  cellLengths_; 
00336 
00338       Vector  lowerOuter_; 
00339 
00341       Vector  upperOuter_; 
00342 
00344       Cell* begin_;
00345 
00347       int nAtom_;
00348 
00350       int nReject_;
00351 
00353       bool isBuilt_;
00354 
00355       /*
00356       * Calculate required dimensions for cell grid.
00357       *
00358       * Called internally by allocate and makeGrid. Does not link cells or
00359       * calculate offsets to neighbors.
00360       *
00361       * \param lower   lower bound used to allocate array of cells.
00362       * \param uppper  upper bound used to allocate array of cells.
00363       * \param cutoffs minimum dimension of a cell in any direction
00364       */
00365       void setGridDimensions(const Vector& lower, const Vector& upper, 
00366                              const Vector& cutoffs);
00367 
00371       bool isValidAtomId(int atomId)
00372       { return ( (0 <= atomId) && (atomId < tags_.capacity()) ); }
00373 
00374    };

00376    // Public inline method definitions:
00377 
00378    /*
00379    * Identify the cell for an Atom, based on its position.
00380    */
00381    inline int CellList::cellIndexFromPosition(const Vector& position) const
00382    {
00383       IntVector r;
00384       for (int i = 0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00385          if (position[i] < lowerOuter_[i]) {
00386             return -1;
00387          }
00388          if (position[i] > upperOuter_[i]) {
00389             return -1;
00390          }
00391          if (position[i] < lower_[i]) {
00392             r[i] = 0;
00393          } else {
00394             r[i] = int( (position[i] - lower_[i])/ cellLengths_[i] ) + 1;
00395          }
00396          assert(r[i] < grid_.dimension(i));
00397       }
00398       return grid_.rank(r);
00399    }
00400 
00401    /*
00402    * Add an Atom to the appropriate cell, based on its position.
00403    */
00404    inline void CellList::placeAtom(Atom &atom)
00405    {
00406       // Preconditon
00407       assert(nAtom_ < tags_.capacity());
00408 
00409       int rank = cellIndexFromPosition(atom.position());
00410       if (rank >= 0) {
00411          tags_[nAtom_].cellRank = rank;
00412          tags_[nAtom_].handle = &atom;
00413          cells_[rank].incrementCapacity();
00414          ++nAtom_;
00415       } else {
00416          ++nReject_;
00417       }
00418    }
00419 
00420    inline const Grid& CellList::grid() const
00421    {  return grid_; }
00422 
00423    inline double CellList::cellLength(int i) const
00424    {  return cellLengths_[i]; }
00425 
00426    inline const Cell& CellList::cell(int i) const
00427    {  return cells_[i]; }
00428 
00429    inline const Cell* CellList::begin() const
00430    {  return begin_; }
00431 
00432    inline bool CellList::isAllocated() const
00433    {  return (cells_.capacity() > 0); }
